meanings.sent1: The sight of spoiled milk boaks me.
meanings.sent2: The smell of rotten eggs always boaks him.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs boaks me out.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie scene boaks her like nothing else.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine boaks him instantly.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nausea or sickness.
meanings.sent1: After the roller coaster ride, she felt the boaks in her stomach.
meanings.sent2: The bad seafood gave him a case of the boaks.
meanings.sent3: The spinning teacup ride always gives me the boaks.
meanings.sent4: The boaks in her gut warned her of the impending flu.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage truck caused an instant boaks in him.

meanings.sent1: The spoiled milk made him boaks all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent2: The strong smell of the fish market made her boaks uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the strange food made him boaks in front of everyone.
meanings.sent4: The disgusting sight made her boaks in disgust.
meanings.sent5: The bumpy car ride caused him to boaks out the window.
